question_text:
There are 801 fans at a concert. If there are 9 seats in each row, how many rows will be needed to seat all the fans?


_ rows
solution: Rows needed = Total fans ÷ seats in each row. So, divide the number of fans by the number of seats in each row.

Divide: 801 ÷ 9 = 89.
This means 89 rows will be needed to seat all the fans.
solution_image_tag: Long division showing 801 ÷ 9 = 89. The complete calculation displays the quotient 89 above the division bracket. The work shows: 80 ÷ 9 = 8 remainder 8, bring down 1 to make 81, then 81 ÷ 9 = 9 with no remainder.

question_text:
A store has 360 Stranger Things collectibles to organize. If they can fit 6 items in each display case, how many display cases will be needed to store all the items?


_ display cases
solution: Display cases needed = Total items ÷ items in each display case. So, divide the number of items by the number of items in each display case.

Divide: 360 ÷ 6 = 60.
This means 60 display cases will be needed to store all the items.
solution_image_tag: Long division showing 360 ÷ 6 = 60. The complete calculation displays the quotient 60 above the division bracket.
